com.indeed.status.core

Interface Dependency

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Callable<CheckResult>, Documented
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDependency, ComparableDependency, DependencyPinger, PingableDependency, SimpleDependency, SimplePingableDependency

    @ThreadSafe
public interface Dependency
extends Callable<CheckResult>, Documented

    A Dependency represents a single system, service, or state that the current running JVM process depends on. The Callable.call() method of the dependency performs some test of the remote dependency to assert its availability. The status of the remote dependency is captured in the CheckResult returned by the executable method.

    The dependency implementation may be triggered by multiple threads simultaneously, and thus must be implemented in a thread-safe manner. No synchronization is performed by the healthcheck framework; any areas of the code that must be guarded must be explicitly locked by the implementation itself.

        call

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        String getId()
        Returns:
        An identifier for this dependency that is unique in the system represented by the client application.

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Returns:
        Human-readable description of the nature of this dependency

      • getDocumentationUrl

        String getDocumentationUrl()
        Specified by:
        getDocumentationUrl in interface Documented
        Returns:
        the URL at which additional information about this dependency can be discovered

      • getTimeout

        long getTimeout()
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds that the dependency should be allowed to execute for before being considered a failure.

      • getPingPeriod

        long getPingPeriod()
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds that the system should delay between automated checks of this dependency. Dependencies that are run on-demand need not worry about this value; this is considered only when launching background pingers

      • getUrgency

        Urgency getUrgency()
        Returns:
        Functor representing the effect of this dependency on the health of the overall system

      • getType

        DependencyType getType()
        Returns:
        The type of this dependency: resource, application or service name, categorization, etc. The interface DependencyType should be implemented for the system accordingly. Examples: mysql, mongo, http service, memory, third party dependency, etc.

      • getServicePool

        String getServicePool()
        Returns:
        The location where the dependent service/resource exists. This will be helpful especially when those service/resources exists in several places, which means when one of these fails, this helps us detect the location immediately. We could avoid grepping the logs. Examples: "dbpool.example.com:3306/mysqldb1", "ServiceName:ZoneName", etc.
